Styleguide

Our Application „MyFarmerApp” helps farmers, gardeners and hobby gardeners how to grow their plants successfully and how to take proper care of them.
In order to do so we combined the knowledge of a plant encyclopedia and the topicality of a weather app in one project.
Due to the steady growth of this project we decided to create style guide for our application and the image of our brand.

This style guide helps our designers, developers, partners and customers to comprehend and reproduce the consistent Design of MyFarmerApp.

Brand Guide

Colors

Since MyFarmerApp is closely connected to working with plants and therefore should be associated with nature, the color palette was chosen to reflect that intent.
It consists mainly of shades ranging from green to brown. For a better readability and to prevent the over saturation of colors, the text is displayed in black on a white background.

Typography

MyFarmerApp uses the Google Font “Lora” as main font. The brushed and curvy design of this font prevents a too strict and serious appearance and represents a more soft and casual style.
Link: Google Font Lora

As second fall back font-family we use Serif.

Logo

Our Logo represents the calm nature of gardening and connects it with the positive aspects of a live as “farmer”. To point out the process of growing something the sprout was added. The size of the logo can be adapted as needed, but it must still be recognizable. The logo is available in color and in black and transparent, which is only to be used for purposes where single color is needed.

CSS Methodology

Code Style

Class Naming

As class naming convention we are using the BEM-Syntax (Block Element Modifier).
This means every independent block has its own CSS-Class and the elements are part of this block, but cannot be reused separately. The element-names are connected to the block by a double underscore “__” and the added subelements have one underscore “_”. If there are multiple words the spaces are represented by two hyphen “--“.

In addition to BEM we uses SASS with the SCSS-Syntax, which helps to implement the BEM naming conventions in CSS.

Components

Contentblock

  • Example
  • HTML
  • CSS
<div class="appcontent"></div>
.appcontent {
  min-height: 10vh;
  width: 90%;
  background-color: #FFFEF2;
  border: 1px black solid;
  border-radius: 5px;
  margin:0 auto;
}

This Contentblock is used to store the main Content of our Webapplication. All content except h1, h3 and the Plantimage are stored in blocks like this.

Headings

  • Example
  • HTML
  • CSS

Heading 1

Heading 2

Heading 3

<h1>Heading 1</h1>
<h2>Heading 2</h2>
<h3>Heading 3</h3>

h1 {
  color: white;
  font-family: 'Slabo 27px', serif;
  letter-spacing: 2px;
  font-weight: lighter;
  padding: 2%;
  text-align: center;
}
h2{
  color: black;
  font-family: 'Slabo 27px', serif;
  font-weight: lighter;
  padding: 1%;
  text-align: center;
}
h3{
  color: white;
  font-family: 'Slabo 27px', serif;
  text-align: left;
  font-weight: lighter;
  padding: 1%;
}

The Heading 1 is used for the Name of the plants in their detailed view. Heading 2 is a heading used for smaller headings in the contentblocks e.g. the month in the calender. The last heading is only used to mute / unmute weathernotifications.

Lists

  • Example
  • HTML
  • CSS
  • Point 1
  • Point 2
  • Point 3
  • Point 4
  • Point 5
<ul>
    <li>Point 1</li>
    <li>Point 2</li>
    <li>Point 3</li>
    <li>Point 4</li>
    <li>Point 5</li>
<ul>
ul {
    display: block;
}
li {
    background-color: $transparent-color;
    color: black;
    width: 90%;
    margin: 0 auto;
    font-family: 'Slabo 27px', serif;
}
li::before {
    content: url('../dist/images/growth.svg');
    margin-left: 20px;
    margin-right: 20px;
}
li:hover {
    background-color: $transparent-color;
    cursor: auto;
}

Our lists are used to show tips and details about plants. We use different icons as bullet points, the icons should show the user what detail the listpoint shows. For example: a watering can to show how often you need to water a certain plant.

Buttons

Button to mute the weathernotifications

  • Example
  • HTML
  • CSS
<svg class="bell--activated display--block" ... ></svg>
<svg class="bell--deactivated display--none" ... ><svg>


let bellActivated = document.querySelector(".bell--activated");
let bellDeactivated = document.querySelector(".bell--deactivated");

bellActivated.addEventListener('click', function() {
    bellActivated.classList.add("display--none");
    bellActivated.classList.remove("display--block");
    bellDeactivated.classList.remove("display--none");
    bellDeactivated.classList.add("display--block");
})

bellDeactivated.addEventListener('click', function() {
    bellDeactivated.classList.remove("display--block");
    bellDeactivated.classList.add("display--none");
    bellActivated.classList.remove("display--none");
    bellActivated.classList.add("display--block");
})   

.bell--activated {
    fill: $light-color;
    height: 10vh;
    margin: 0 auto;
}

.bell--deactivated {
    fill: $light-color;
    height: 10vh;
    margin: 0 auto;
}

This Button is used to mute and unmute weathernotifications.

My Plant button + mute button

  • Example
  • HTML
  • CSS

My Plant 1

<div class="appcontent">
    <p>My Plant 1</p>
    <svg class="bell--activated display--block" ... ></svg>
    <svg class="bell--deactivated display--none" ... ><svg>
</div>


let bellActivated = document.querySelector(".bell--activated");
let bellDeactivated = document.querySelector(".bell--deactivated");

bellActivated.addEventListener('click', function() {
    bellActivated.classList.add("display--none");
    bellActivated.classList.remove("display--block");
    bellDeactivated.classList.remove("display--none");
    bellDeactivated.classList.add("display--block");
})

bellDeactivated.addEventListener('click', function() {
    bellDeactivated.classList.remove("display--block");
    bellDeactivated.classList.add("display--none");
    bellActivated.classList.remove("display--none");
    bellActivated.classList.add("display--block");
})   

.appcontent{
    display: flex;
    color: $dark-color;
    font-family: 'Slabo 27px', serif;
    p {
        padding: 5% 2vw;
        width: 400%;
        font-size: 1.5em;
    }
    svg {
        margin-top: 3.5%;
        height: 6vh;
    }
}

.appcontent:hover{
    box-shadow: 1px 1px 1px 1px $medium-color;
}

This Button is used to get to the Detailsite of a plant. You can also mute and unmute tips of the plant.

Form Elements

Dropdown

  • Example
  • HTML
  • CSS
Saalfelden am Steinernen Meer Salzburg Fucking 
<div class="appcontent"></div>

This Dropdown menu is used for the user to choose which town they want to see the weather information from.

Navigation

  • Example
  • HTML
  • CSS
<nav class="navigation--app">
    <div class="container" onclick="burgermenue(this)">
        <div class="bar1"><div>
        <div class="bar2"><div>
        <div class="bar3"><div>
    <div>
    <img src="images/sprout_sheep.svg" alt="logo">
<nav>
.container {
    display: inline-block;
    cursor: pointer;
    padding: 0.5% 1%;
}

.bar1, .bar2, .bar3 {
    width: 35px;
    height: 5px;
    background-color: $light-color;
    margin: 6px 0;
    transition: 0.4s;
}

/* Rotate first bar */
.change .bar1 {
    -webkit-transform: rotate(-45deg) translate(-9px, 6px) ;
    transform: rotate(-45deg) translate(-9px, 6px) ;
}

/* Fade out the second bar */
.change .bar2 {
    opacity: 0;
}

/* Rotate last bar */
.change .bar3 {
    -webkit-transform: rotate(45deg) translate(-8px, -8px) ;
    transform: rotate(45deg) translate(-8px, -8px) ;
}

.navigation--app {
        img{
        height: 5vh;
        float: right;              
        padding: 0.5vh;
    }
}

The Navigation is seen on every page. It's a simple burger menu that navigates to all the main pages.

Layouts

1 Weather

In this Layout you can see the startpage of the MyFarmerApp. The Navigation is like on the other pages. There is a Dropdown menu to choose the right town. The Detailed Weather Contentblock shows todays weather by default - you can click on other small weather content blocks to see them as detailed weather blocks.
The last element of the page is a muteblock, you can mute and unmute push notifications.

2 Calender

This Layout shows the basic layout of the calender page. There is a Content block that shows this months weeks and a mooncalender. There is also a Contentblock for tips for the current date.

3 Detail

This Layout is the Detailed View of a plant. At top of the page, there is a image of the choosen plant. The heading displays the name of the plant. The Contentblock Detail shows details of the plants like "height, need for water, planting time, etc.".

Styleguide von Julia und Michaela! :))
